meanings.definition: A Jewish ritual bath used for purification.
meanings.sent1: The community built a new mikveh for ceremonial cleansing.
meanings.sent2: She visited the mikveh before her wedding to purify herself.
meanings.sent3: The ducks mistook the mikveh for a pond and had a splash party!
meanings.sent4: The mikveh stood as a sacred well, offering spiritual rebirth to all who entered.
meanings.sent5: The mikveh's waters shimmered with purity, inviting all to wash away their sins.

meanings.definition: To immerse oneself in a mikveh for spiritual cleansing.
meanings.sent1: Before the holiday, they will mikveh to prepare their souls.
meanings.sent2: He felt renewed after mikvehing in the holy waters.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to mikveh in the bathtub, thinking it was a sacred pool!
meanings.sent4: She would mikveh in the ocean of prayer, letting the waves of faith wash over her.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, they would mikveh in the river, letting go of the day's worries.
